alert.note: Alert for Chaffee; Fremont (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 08 at 8:53AM MST until December 08 at 9:15AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Chaffee County in central Colorado... Northwestern Fremont County in central Colorado... * Until 915 AM MST. * At 852 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Waugh Mountain to 9 miles northeast of Swissvale to near Howard, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 50 east of Salida. Locations impacted include... Salida, Swissvale, Howard, and Waugh Mountain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
